channel.description: Recent content in home on kasreti's crib

item.title: Half-Consonants and the Evolution of Cosyran
item.description: Over the course of the past two weeks, I’ve been revamping my conscript (writing system): Isyax√© Kiryada. While teaching the script to my friends, I realized that a fatal flaw with the script was that even after previous updates, it was unable to express certain consonant clusters, such as in the phrase cosyran ka (note that c is pronounced like ch, and sy is pronounced like sh). But why? Why didn’t I just design the script to support such a basic feature of the language to begin with?

item.description: hello welcome to michaelsof i’ve uh yet to make a proper blog page check out the about section for now the new world order is here!!!

item.title: about
item.description: Welcome to kasreti’s crib! This is basically where I’ll put any long ramblings I have – but what should you expect here? Linguistics and conlangs I do reading on my own about linguistics quite often, so I’ll put any new discoveries that I find cool here and share them. I’ll try to put more explainer notes around to clarify some terminology since 90% of the people reading this blog will have zero clue about linguistics.
